\section*{ELEC 460 Assignment 7}

\begin{par}
State-Space Model
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{verbatim}
format compact
syms z
\end{verbatim}
\begin{par}
Consider the discrete-time state equation
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{par}
$$
\begin{bmatrix} x_1(k+1) \\
x_2(k+1)
\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}
0     &  1 \\
-0.24 & -1
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}
x_1(k) \\
x_2(k)
\end{bmatrix}
$$
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{par}
Obtain the state transition matrix $\Psi(k)$
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{par}
Since $\displaystyle \psi(k)=G^k= \mathcal{Z}^{-1} \left\{z[zI-G]^{-1}\right\}$, and
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{par}
$$
A=\begin{bmatrix}
a     &  b \\
c &  d
\end{bmatrix}^{-1}= \frac{1}{ad-bc}\begin{bmatrix}
d     &  -b \\
-c &  a
\end{bmatrix}
$$
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{par}
$$
\begin{align*}
& \mathcal{Z}^{-1} \left\{z[zI-G]^{-1}\right\} = z \begin{bmatrix}
z     &  -1 \\
0.24 & z+1
\end{bmatrix}^{-1}= \mathcal{Z}^{-1} \left\{\frac{z}{z^2+z-(-1)(0.24)}\begin{bmatrix}
z+1     &  1 \\
-0.24 & z
\end{bmatrix} \right\} \\
& \frac{F(z)}{z}=\mathcal{Z}^{-1} \left\{\frac{1}{(z+0.4)(z-0.6)}\begin{bmatrix}
z+1     &  1 \\
-0.24 & z
\end{bmatrix} \right\}
\end{align*}
$$
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
